title: 'Morbidly obese' man is cleared of raping woman he met on Match.com
text:
Christopher Schubert (seen outside court on October 8) was cleared of two counts of rape and two counts of sexual assault

A 'morbidly obese' man wept in court as he was cleared of raping a woman he met on Match.com.

Christopher Schubert, who advertised himself online as a 'big cuddly bear looking for his mate', persuaded a jury at Oxford Crown Court the sexual encounter was consensual.

The 44-year-old was cleared of two charges of rape and two counts of assault by penetration and walked free from Oxford Crown Court after a four-day trial.

The jury was told that the woman, who was single following the end of a relationship, arranged for Mr Schubert to come to her home in Oxford on January 30 last year 'for a cup of tea and a chat'.

The woman, a separated mother, said she had been full of hope at the prospect of meeting someone and starting a new relationship.

But when he arrived she thought: 'S***, you're huge', Oxford Crown Court heard she told police.

The next morning, following his departure in the early hours, the alleged victim reported to police that Schubert sexually assaulted and raped her.

During the interview she wept and told officers: 'I had already said we were not going to have sex.

'You end up getting to know someone over a cup of tea and I invited him in to be sociable. I thought he was going to have a cup of tea and chat.'

Jurors took four hours and four minutes to clear Mr Schubert, who broke down in tears and sobbed loudly. He is pictured with his mother

Later in the trial, Mr Schubert took to the witness box so claim the woman 'enjoyed' the intimacy and showed no signs she was not consenting.

Jurors took four hours and four minutes to clear the defendant, who broke down in tears and sobbed loudly.

After the verdicts were given last week, Mr Schubert broke down in tears and sobbed loudly.

Judge Nigel Daly told jurors: 'As you can see trials with allegations such as these are very emotional affairs.

'It is something which is very difficult to do, we greatly appreciate you have come to this court as members of the public to try other members of the public.

'If you didn't do that then the criminal justice system simply could not continue.'
description: Christopher Schubert, who advertised himself online as a 'big cuddly bear looking for his mate', persuaded a jury at Oxford Crown Court the sexual encounter was consensual.
